title: Quantum Benchmarking Solution File Schema
description: Describes required fields for a valid solution file.

$schema.title: Schema URI
$schema.desription: A hyperlink to the schema that describes this JSON object.

solution_uuid.title: Solution UUID
solution_uuid.description: The UUID of the solution being submitted as a string in 8-4-4-4-12 format.

problem_instance_uuid.title: Problem Instance UUID
problem_instance_uuid.description: The UUID of the problem instance that the solution is based on.

creation_timestamp.title: Creation Timestamp
creation_timestamp.description:
Timestamp in ISO 8601 format in UTC (note the `Z`).

Examples:  
`2022-12-25T18:00:02.223Z`,
`2022-12-25T07:18:45Z`

short_name.title: Short Name
short_name.description: A short string.  Not necessarily unique.

other_info.title: Other Information
other_info.description: An optional object with no required structure for the test performer to put other contact information or comments in.

is_resource_estimate.title: Is Resource Estimate
is_resource_estimate.description: A boolean indicating whether the solution is an estimate of a solver's performance. If this field is not set, it is assumed to be false.

solution_data.title: Solution Data
solution_data.description: A list of objects describing the solution of each of the problem's tasks.

error_bound.title: Error Bound
error_bound.description: Bound on the absolute energy error.

confidence_level.title: Confidence Level
confidence_level.description: Probability that the absolute energy error is less than the error bound.

classical_resources.title: Classical Resources
classical_resources.description: Required classical compute resources. Anything not included here is assumed to be the same as the values in solver_details.

total_num_cores.title: Total number of cores used.
total_num_cores.description: The total number of cores used.

ram_used_gb.title: RAM (GB)
ram_used_gb.description: Total RAM available for the computation, in GB.

computing_environment_name.title: Computing Environment Name
computing_environment_name.description: Identifying name of computing environment (e.g. cluster or facility name), if relevant.

quantum_resources.title: Quantum Resources
quantum_resources.description: Quantum resources used by the test performer.

physical.title: Physical Quantum Resources
physical.description: Physical quantum resources used by the test performer. Exact structure is TBD.

logical.title: Logical Quantum Resources
logical.description: Logical quantum resources used by the test performer. Exact structure is TBD.

run_time.title: Wall Clock Runtime
run_time.description: A breakdown of start/stop wall clock time(s) reported according to ISO 8601 in UTC and duration in seconds.  run_time is broken down into (1) overall_time, (2) preprocessing_time, (3), algorithm_run_time, and (4) postprocessing_time.  See descriptions of each object.

overall_time.title: Overall Wall Clock Time
overall_time.description: Includes all pre/postprocessing times and algorithm_run_time.

wall_clock_start_time.title: Wall Clock Start Time
wall_clock_start_time.description:
Timestamp in ISO 8601 format in UTC (note the `Z`).

Examples:  
`2022-12-25T18:00:02.223Z`,
`2022-12-25T07:18:45Z`

wall_clock_stop_time.title: Wall Clock Stop Time
wall_clock_stop_time.description:
Timestamp in ISO 8601 format in UTC (note the `Z`).

Examples:  
`2022-12-25T18:00:02.223Z`,
`2022-12-25T07:18:45Z`

seconds.title: Duration in Seconds
seconds.description: The number of seconds that has elapsed between start/stop times reported.

preprocessing_time.title: Preprocessing Wall Clock Time
preprocessing_time.description: The time required to load any data into an idle machine before running an algorithm.

wall_clock_start_time.title: Wall Clock Start Time
wall_clock_start_time.description:
Timestamp in ISO 8601 format in UTC (note the `Z`).

Examples:  
`2022-12-25T18:00:02.223Z`,
`2022-12-25T07:18:45Z`

wall_clock_stop_time.title: Wall Clock Stop Time
wall_clock_stop_time.description:
Timestamp in ISO 8601 format in UTC (note the `Z`).

Examples:  
`2022-12-25T18:00:02.223Z`,
`2022-12-25T07:18:45Z`

seconds.title: Duration in Seconds
seconds.description: The number of seconds that has elapsed between start/stop times reported.

algorithm_run_time.title: Algorithm Run Time
algorithm_run_time.description: The start/stop times for how long the software/algorithm ran.

wall_clock_start_time.title: Wall Clock Start Time
wall_clock_start_time.description:
Timestamp in ISO 8601 format in UTC (note the `Z`).

Examples:  
`2022-12-25T18:00:02.223Z`,
`2022-12-25T07:18:45Z`

wall_clock_stop_time.title: Wall Clock Stop Time
wall_clock_stop_time.description:
Timestamp in ISO 8601 format in UTC (note the `Z`).

Examples:  
`2022-12-25T18:00:02.223Z`,
`2022-12-25T07:18:45Z`

seconds.title: Duration in Seconds
seconds.description: The number of seconds that has elapsed between start/stop times reported.

compute_node_run_time_breakdown.title: Compute Node Run Time Breakdown
compute_node_run_time_breakdown.description:
Breakdown of algorithm_run_time across multiple nodes if a cluster of multiple machines was utilized.

This object is optional.  There is no required structure for this object.

postprocessing_time.title: Postprocessing Wall Clock Time
postprocessing_time.description: The time required measure or read out any data from the machine.  .

wall_clock_start_time.title: Wall Clock Start Time
wall_clock_start_time.description:
Timestamp in ISO 8601 format in UTC (note the `Z`).

Examples:  
`2022-12-25T18:00:02.223Z`,
`2022-12-25T07:18:45Z`

wall_clock_stop_time.title: Wall Clock Stop Time
wall_clock_stop_time.description:
Timestamp in ISO 8601 format in UTC (note the `Z`).

Examples:  
`2022-12-25T18:00:02.223Z`,
`2022-12-25T07:18:45Z`

seconds.title: Duration in Seconds
seconds.description: The number of seconds that has elapsed between start/stop times reported.

solver_details.title: Compute Hardware & Software Details
solver_details.description: Details on the hardware and software (algorithm) used by the test performer. Each Algorithm + Software Implementation + Hardware has its own solver_uuid.

solver_uuid.title: Solver UUID
solver_uuid.description: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) as a string in RFC4122 8-4-4-4-12 format. Each Algorithm + Software Implementation + Hardware has its own UUID.

compute_hardware_type.title: Compute Hardware Type
compute_hardware_type.description:
Type of device the algorithm is actually run on.  Choose from:

`classical_computer` 
`quantum_computer` 
`hybrid_classical_quantum_computer` 
`other`.

classical_hardware_details.title: Classical Compute Hardware Details
classical_hardware_details.description: Details on the hardware used by the solver. All tasks are assumed to have the included values unless specified otherwise at the task level.

total_num_cores.title: Total number of cores used.
total_num_cores.description: The total number of cores used.

ram_used_gb.title: RAM (GB)
ram_used_gb.description: Total RAM available for the computation, in GB.

computing_environment_name.title: Computing Environment Name
computing_environment_name.description: Identifying name of computing environment (e.g. cluster or facility name), if relevant.

quantum_hardware_details.title: Quantum Compute Hardware Details
quantum_hardware_details.description: Details on the hardware used by the test performer. Exact structure is TBD.

algorithm_details.title: Algorithm Details
algorithm_details.description: Details on the algorithm used by the test performer. Includes broad descriptions and/or literature references.

software_details.title: Software Details
software_details.description: Details on the software used by the test performer. Includes all relevant software, with version numbers, literature reference(s) and url(s).

digital_signature.title: Digital Signature
digital_signature.description: This is created by the benchmark performer and their private key.  It is calculated over the TBD object.  If this is not implemented, it may be set to null
